alert.note: Alert for Allen; Huntington; Wells; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 10:20PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Allen, southeastern Whitley, northeastern Huntington and north central Wells Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1019 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Huntington, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Allen, southeastern Whitley, northeastern Huntington and north central Wells Counties, including the following locations... Laud, Nine Mile, Bowerstown, Yoder, Dunfee, Aboite, Goblesville, Roanoke, Arcola and Mahon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 10. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 289 and 306. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
